workflow.name: Auto-generate blog posts with GPT, Leonardo AI, and Wordpress publishing
workflow.description:
## Trigger & Topic Extraction

The workflow starts manually or from a chat/Telegram/webhook input.

A ‚Äútopic extractor‚Äù node scans the incoming text and cleans it (handles /topic ‚Ä¶ commands).

If no topic is detected, it defaults to a sample news headline.

## Style & Structure Setup

A style guide node defines the blog‚Äôs tone: practical, medium‚Äìlow formality, clear sections, clean HTML only.

It also enforces do‚Äôs (citations, links, actionable steps) and don‚Äôts (no clickbait, no low-quality sources).

## Research & Drafting

A GPT node generates a 1,700‚Äì1,800 word article following the style guide.

Sections include: What happened, Why it matters, Opportunities/risks, Action plan, FAQ.

The draft is then polished for clarity and flow.

## Quality Control

A word count guard checks that the article is at least 1,600 words.

If too short, a GPT ‚Äúexpand draft‚Äù node deepens the Why it matters, Risks, and Action plan sections.

## Image Creation

The final article‚Äôs title and content are used to generate an editorial-style image prompt.

Leonardo AI creates a cinematic, text-free featured image suitable for Google News/Discover.

The image is uploaded to WordPress, with proper ALT text generated by GPT.

## Publishing to WordPress

The final post (title, content, featured image) is automatically published.

Sources are extracted from the article, compiled into a ‚ÄúSources‚Äù section with clickable links.

Posts are categorized and published immediately.

values.content:
=Expand this article to exceed 1,800 words by deepening ‚ÄúWhy it matters‚Äù,
‚ÄúWinners/risks‚Äù, and a more detailed ‚ÄúAction plan‚Äù. Keep the same voice
and existing links intact.

{{ JSON.stringify($json.draft || $json) }}

nodes.name: Get Title, Content, and Image FileName

values.content:
=Generate a single-line English description of an editorial-style image to visually represent the following article.

The image must follow these rules:
- Cinematic, editorial look (not cartoonish or abstract).
- No visible text or logos.
- Must work for a blog post featured image in Google News and Discover (ideal size: 1200x628 px).
- The article title is: "{{ $json.title }}"
- Article content: {{ $json.content }}.

Output just the English prompt, without quotes or formatting.

You are an expert in crafting AI image generation prompts for editorial and news images. You help generate cinematic, editorial-style prompts for blog images that perform well in Google News and Google Discover. Avoid any text or logos in the result.

parameters.name: Content-Disposition
parameters.value: =attachment; filename="{{ $('Get Title, Content, and Image FileName').item.json.image_filename }}"

parameters.jsonBody: ={{ { "title": $("Get Title, Content, and Image FileName").item.json.title, "content": $("Get Title, Content, and Image FileName").item.json.content, "status": "publish", "categories": [916], "featured_media": $("Upload Image to Wordpress").item.json.id } }}

parameters.content: Builds the style of Blog and research body.
Reasearch's and revises the tone and format
Creates prompt for image and creates image.

main.node: Get Title, Content, and Image FileName
Get Title, Content, and Image FileName

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
